subject: Leadership
title: Giving Constructive Feedback
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Giving Constructive Feedback.

hook.text: A manager waits six months to flag a problem to an employee. By then it's a crisis. Early feedback would have fixed it.

buildup.text: Feedback is a gift, but most people deliver it like a weapon. Timing, tone, and framing make all the difference.

discovery.text: The SBI model: describe the Situation, the Behavior, and the Impact. Skip judgment. Stick to observable facts.

twist.text: Positive feedback matters more than negative. A 5:1 ratio of positive to constructive creates a high-performing team.

climax.text: Give feedback within 48 hours, in private, with care. End with a question: 'How do you see it?' Dialogue beats lecture.

quiz.question: What does the SBI feedback model stand for?
